info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 PM EDT, The public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Numerous roads within Downtown Charleston had deep standing water, indicated by social media reports and traffic maps. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen across the Charleston Peninsula and portions of West Ashley and Shadowmoss. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. In addition, rapid rises were observed on Church Creek near West Ashley. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, James Island, Johns Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Charles Towne Landing, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Naval Complex, Don Holt Bridge, Westmoreland Bridge, Citadel Mall, Oakland, Maryville, Shadowmoss and Saint Andrews.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
